snippet.textDisplay:
Where The Mind Is Without Fear
Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high
Where knowledge is free
Where the world has not been broken up into fragments
By narrow domestic walls
Where words come out from the depth of truth
Where tireless striving stretches its arms towards perfection
Where the clear stream of reason has not lost its way
Into the dreary desert sand of dead habit
Where the mind is led forward by thee
Into ever-widening thought and action
Into that heaven of freedom;
snippet.textOriginal:
Where The Mind Is Without Fear
Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high
Where knowledge is free
Where the world has not been broken up into fragments
By narrow domestic walls
Where words come out from the depth of truth
Where tireless striving stretches its arms towards perfection
Where the clear stream of reason has not lost its way
Into the dreary desert sand of dead habit
Where the mind is led forward by thee
Into ever-widening thought and action
Into that heaven of freedom;

If they r making suposedly a song on national intergation , desh, love for the desh, sacrifice to get this independence... there is a gem by another genius/ pillar  of bengali language poetry -- that is - the song " Muktiro mondir" by the " bidrohi-kabi" ie "Rebel poet" .. kazi nazrul Islam...for people not knowing him.. google...that song stirs up ur souls... makes your blodd boil..n everytime brings me to tears....

snippet.textDisplay: If we are talking about Rehman's diction and suggesting he should not sing bengali songs i question where do we stand? Let me put this in perspective.If you stop Rehman because of is bengali diction from singing, you should stop me from reciting any hindi poem . Beacuse i have a bengali accent in my hindi and english. By doing that you are probably confining your art and literature and you are making it only for the privileged. This is dangerous tendency.do we remember how hollow cast hppnd?
snippet.textOriginal: If we are talking about Rehman's diction and suggesting he should not sing bengali songs i question where do we stand? Beacuse i have a bengali accent in my hindi and english. By doing that you are probably confining your art and literature and you are making it only for the privileged. snippet.textDisplay: Rabi Tagore didn't write the song for Bengali though it is in Bengali. Rabi Tagore is for all and everyone has full right to take it in his/her way because he wrote for human not for Region etc... And this song has strong appeal in India's present context and A.R Rahman did absolute justice by choosing it. But people with strong "Rabindra Sense" (understands Rabindranath) thinks that they r protecting Rabi's Art by making – criticism; actually making a demolition of all tm gr8 work!
snippet.textOriginal: Rabi Tagore didn't write the song for Bengali though it is in Bengali. Rabi Tagore is for all and everyone has full right to take it in his/her way because he wrote for human not for Region etc... And this song has strong appeal in India's present context and A.R Rahman did absolute justice by choosing it. But people with strong "Rabindra Sense" (understands Rabindranath) thinks that they r protecting Rabi's Art by making – criticism; actually making a demolition of all tm gr8 work!

snippet.textDisplay: Being a hardcore bengali, i welcome this move by Sir Rahman openly. Rabindranath Tagore is not a personality to be confined within only a certain language and a few able to speak in that very language. Very nice experiment at all. And India in 2013 is not a perfect place for stubborn people.

Rabindranath Tagore is not a personality to be confined within only a certain language and a few able to speak in that very language. Very nice experiment at all. snippet.textDisplay: am a born Tagore fan & someone who considers ARR saab as my god....dis is a fascinating piece i must say...come on, why so much hullabaloo abt ARR's pronunciation? its coming frm d heart and dats all dat matters...simply enjoy ppl....being a student of music all i can say is dat a true genius nvr disrespects another genius....hence enjoy dis magnificent tribute of ARR saab towards one of d greatest gems of India,Tagore.....cheers!!

snippet.textDisplay: I'm a pakka bangali and I think it's a awesome song, kudos to AR Rahman for this! Well it's easier to stay within your limits and choose something safe... being a tamil he could have easily chosen a tamil poem to sing and no one would be criticizing him for that... but he decided to push his boundaries so you should appreciate him for that... also he's bringing a beautiful language like bengali to the world stage.. you should appreciate the effort at least even if not his accent...
snippet.textOriginal: I'm a pakka bangali and I think it's a awesome song, kudos to AR Rahman for this! Well it's easier to stay within your limits and choose something safe... being a tamil he could have easily chosen a tamil poem to sing and no one would be criticizing him for that... but he decided to push his boundaries so you should appreciate him for that... also he's bringing a beautiful language like bengali to the world stage.. you should appreciate the effort at least even if not his accent...

snippet.textDisplay: Bengalis like you are best at criticizing others but would never try something like this yourself. Your "true criticism" is just because you can't tolerate anyone interpreting Tagore. It is an old habit of Bengalis to incinerate anyone who does so, right from Debabrata Biswas to Neel Dutt who have tried to infuse some life & modernization to his notations and music arrangements. I wanted to attack that tendency and not Bengalis. And FYI, I am a distinction holder in Tagore music from Dakshinee.
snippet.textOriginal: Bengalis like you are best at criticizing others but would never try something like this yourself. Your "true criticism" is just because you can't tolerate anyone interpreting Tagore. It is an old habit of Bengalis to incinerate anyone who does so, right from Debabrata Biswas to Neel Dutt who have tried to infuse some life & modernization to his notations and music arrangements. I wanted to attack that tendency and not Bengalis. And FYI, I am a distinction holder in Tagore music from Dakshinee.

snippet.textDisplay: Tagore is beyond everything..he is for everyone..it depends how you will find him out..I personally feel that being a non-bengali this attempt of A.R.Rahaman to turn a Popular Bengali poem to song is really appreciating.beside that he sang it in it's real version in Bengali.as a Bengali I feel Proud that someone so famous had tried it in our mother tongue..by the way does anybody else experiment with Tagore's songs yet? So why so comment about A.R. Rahaman's attempt?

1st comment Mistake 1: Shame "to" AR Raheman... it should be shame "on" you
1st comment Mistake 2: ..have 'a' golden collection's' - a and plural cannot go together
2nd comment Mistake 1: an war... it should be "a war"
2nd comment Mistake 2: couldn't able - it should be "wasn't able"...
Already you have talked a lot of nonsense. Now don't make another mistake of getting after me with your "excellent" English and even better music sense... who told u to listen to this anyway?

snippet.textDisplay: Because of these narrow-minded Bengalis who can't resist to comment here, others get the liberty to blame the race as a whole. Bengalis in 18 & 1900s were visionaries who dreamt of and shaped a free India. Bengalis were regarded as the most open-minded & progressive of Indians. Most of the martyrs of our independence came from Bengal. And they never fought for a separate Bengal. And now we are degraded to criticizing a global musician who is trying to sing some great words by a great poet.
snippet.textOriginal: Because of these narrow-minded Bengalis who can't resist to comment here, others get the liberty to blame the race as a whole. Bengalis in 18 & 1900s were visionaries who dreamt of and shaped a free India. Bengalis were regarded as the most open-minded & progressive of Indians. Most of the martyrs of our independence came from Bengal. And they never fought for a separate Bengal. And now we are degraded to criticizing a global musician who is trying to sing some great words by a great poet.

snippet.textDisplay:
Blaaze's real name is Lakshmi Narasimha Vijaya Rajagopala Sheshadri Sharma Rajesh Raman. :\ 
Yep, Blaaze is better. :P

snippet.textDisplay: I feel really ashamed of fellow Bengalis who are abusing this page by criticizing Rahman's diction, pronunciation, etc. and his supposed blasphemy of touching the respectably untouchable Tagore. We have deified Tagore such that if someone tries to re-invent Him, people will criticize. Tagore always dreamt of a great unified India & look at his successors who complain abt mispronunciation of his poem which talks about breaking down boundaries of countries. What an irony! Jagao mere desh, alas...
snippet.textOriginal: I feel really ashamed of fellow Bengalis who are abusing this page by criticizing Rahman's diction, pronunciation, etc. and his supposed blasphemy of touching the respectably untouchable Tagore. Tagore always dreamt of a great unified India & look at his successors who complain abt mispronunciation of his poem which talks about breaking down boundaries of countries. What an irony!
